Shen Excerpt from The Kiss Thief Prologue Chapter One

Cruel . Cold - blooded . [Hades]136-hades in a Brioni suit . [Cillian Fitzpatrick]137-cillian has been dubbed [every wicked thing on [planet Earth]512-planet earth]511-every wicked thing on planet earth . To the media , [he]137-cillian is [The Villain]513-the villain . To [me]0-i , [he]137-cillian is [the man who ( reluctantly ) saved [my]0-i life]514-the man who ( reluctantly ) saved my life . Now [I]0-i need [him]137-cillian to do [me]0-i another small solid . Bail [me]0-i out of the mess [[my]0-i husband]515-my husband got [me]0-i into . What ’s a hundred grand to [one of [the wealthiest men in [America]1-america]517-the wealthiest men in america]516-one of the wealthiest men in america , anyway ? Only [Cillian]137-cillian does n’t hand out favors for free . The price for the money , it turns out , is [my]0-i freedom . Now [I]0-i ’m [the eldest Fitzpatrick brother]518-the eldest fitzpatrick brother ’s little toy . To play , to mold , to break . Too bad [Cillian]137-cillian forgot one tiny detail . [Persephone]138-persephone was n’t only [the goddess of spring]519-the goddess of spring , [she]138-persephone was also [the queen of death]520-the queen of death . [He]137-cillian thinks [I]0-i ’ll buckle under the weight of [his]137-cillian mind games . [He]137-cillian is about to find out the most lethal poison is also the sweetest .

[Sub Urban]2-sub urban : “ Cradles ”[139-bishop briggs] [Bishop Briggs]139-bishop briggs : “ [River ”]3815-river ”[139-bishop briggs] [White Stripes]140-white stripes : “ Hardest Button to Button ”[140-white stripes] [Gogol Bordello]3-gogol bordello : “ [Sally]141-sally ”[139-bishop briggs] Milk and [Bone]142-bone : “ Peaches ”[142-bone] [Nick Cave]4-nick cave and the Bad Seeds : “ Red Right Hand ”[139-bishop briggs]

To [Cori]143-cori and [Lana]144-lana .

Lost in [Hell]257-hell , [Persephone]138-persephone , Take [her]138-persephone head upon [your]521-your knee ; Say to [her]138-persephone , “ [[My]145-edna st. vincent millay dear]3816-my dear , [[my]145-edna st. vincent millay dear]3816-my dear , It is not so dreadful here . ”[145-edna st. vincent millay] — [Edna St. Vincent Millay]145-edna st. vincent millay , Collected Poems The bleeding heart is a pink and white flower that bears a striking resemblance to the conventional heart shape . It is also referred to as the heart flower or as [lady - in - bath]522-lady - in - bath . The flower is known to be poisonous to the touch and deadly to consume . And , like [the mythological goddess [Persephone]138-persephone]523-the mythological goddess persephone , it only blossoms in spring .

[My]0-i love story started with a death . With the sound of [my]0-i soul shattering on the hospice floor like delicate china . And [Auntie Tilda]146-auntie tilda , wilting inside [[her]146-auntie tilda hospital bed]524-her hospital bed , [her]146-auntie tilda breath rattling in [her]146-auntie tilda empty lungs like a penny . [I]0-i soaked [her]146-auntie tilda hospital gown with tears , clutching the fabric in [my]0-i little fists , ignoring [Momma]147-momma ’s soft pleas to get off [[her]146-auntie tilda ill sister]525-her ill sister . “ Please do n’t leave , [Auntie]146-auntie tilda . Please , ”[0-i] [I]0-i croaked . The cancer had spread to [her]146-auntie tilda lungs , liver , and kidneys , making it excruciating for [[my]0-i aunt]526-my aunt to breathe . For the past few weeks , [she]146-auntie tilda ’s slept sitting upright , falling in and out of consciousness . At twelve , death was an abstract concept to [me]0-i . Real , but also foreign and faraway . Something that happened in [other families]527-other families , to [other people]528-other people . [I]0-i understood what it meant now . [Auntie Tilda]146-auntie tilda was never going to scoop [me]0-i in [her]146-auntie tilda arms , pretending to strum [her]146-auntie tilda fingers on [me]0-i like [I]0-i was [an air guitar]529-an air guitar again . [She]146-auntie tilda ’d never pick [Belle]148-belle and [me]0-i up from [school]530-school with Ziploc bags full of apple slices and strawberries whenever [[our]531-our parents]532-our parents worked long hours . [She]146-auntie tilda ’d never braid [my]0-i hair again , whispering magical tales about Greek gods and [three - headed monsters]533-three - headed monsters . [[My]0-i aunt]526-my aunt tucked wisps of blond curls behind [my]0-i ear . [Her]146-auntie tilda eyes shimmered with sickness so tangible [I]0-i could taste it on [my]0-i tongue . “ Leave ? ”[146-auntie tilda] [She]146-auntie tilda belched . “ Oh , [my]146-auntie tilda , that ’s a big word . [I]146-auntie tilda ’d never do that , [Persy]149-persy . Dead , alive , and in - between , [I]146-auntie tilda will always be there for [you]149-persy . ”[146-auntie tilda] “ But how ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i tugged at [her]146-auntie tilda gown , clinging to [her]146-auntie tilda promise . “ How will [I]0-i know [you]149-persy ’re really here after [your]149-persy body is gone ? ”[0-i] “ Just turn [your]149-persy face up , [you]149-persy silly goose . The sky will always be [ours]536-we . That ’s where [we]536-we ’ll meet , between the sunrays and the clouds . ”[146-auntie tilda] On hot , sticky summers , [Auntie Tilda]146-auntie tilda and [I]0-i would lie on the grass by [Charles River]6-charles river , cloud - spotting . The clouds came and went like passengers at [a train station]535-a train station . First , [we]536-we ’d count them . Then [we]536-we ’d choose the funny - shaped , extra fluffy ones . Then [we]536-we ’d give [them]537-them names . [Mr.]538-mr. and [Mrs. Claudia]150-mrs. claudia and [Claud Clowdton]151-claud clowdton . [Misty and Smoky Frost]152-misty and smoky frost . [Auntie Tilda]146-auntie tilda believed in magic , in miracles , and [I]0-i ? Well , [I]0-i believed in [her]146-auntie tilda . While [[my]0-i older sister]539-my older sister , [Emmabelle]153-emmabelle , chased after squirrels , played soccer with [the boys]540-the boys , and climbed trees , [Auntie Tilda]146-auntie tilda and [I]0-i admired the sky . “ Will [you]146-auntie tilda give [me]0-i a sign ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i pressed . “ That [you]146-auntie tilda ’re there in the sky ? A lightning ? Rain ? Oh , [I]0-i know ! Maybe a pigeon can poop on [me]0-i . ”[0-i] [Momma]147-momma put [her]147-momma hand on [my]0-i shoulder . In the words of [[my]0-i sister]541-my sister [Belle]148-belle — [I]0-i needed to take a chill pill , and fast . “ Let ’s make a deal , ”[147-momma] [[my]0-i aunt]526-my aunt suggested , laughing breathlessly . “ As [you]0-i know , clouds are more reliable than shooting stars . Common , but still magical . When the time comes and [you]0-i grow up , ask for something [you]0-i want — something [you]0-i really want — when [you]0-i see a lone cloud in the sky , and [I]147-momma will grant it to [you]0-i . That ’s how [you]0-i ’ll know [I]147-momma ’m there watching . [You]0-i only get one miracle , [Persephone]138-persephone , so be careful what [you]0-i wish for . But [I]147-momma promise , whatever [your]0-i wish may be — [I]147-momma will grant it to [you]0-i . ”[147-momma] [I]0-i ’d kept [my]0-i Cloud Wish for eleven years , harboring it like a precious heirloom . [I]0-i did n’t use it when [my]0-i grades slipped . When [Elliott Frasier]154-elliott frasier came up with the nickname [Pussyfanny Peen - rise]155-pussyfanny peen - rise sophomore year , and it stuck until graduation . Not even when [Dad]156-dad got laid off and [McDonald]157-mcdonald ’s and hot water became rare luxuries . In the end , [I]0-i wasted the Cloud Wish in one , reckless moment . On a doomed desire , [a stupid crush]543-a stupid crush , [an unrequited lover]544-an unrequited lover . On [the man every media outlet in [America]1-america]545-the man every media outlet in america referred to as [The Villain]513-the villain . On [Cillian Fitzpatrick]137-cillian .

Three Years Ago . [I]0-i was drunk before noon the day [[my]0-i best friend]547-my best friend , [Sailor]158-sailor , got married . Typically , [I]0-i was fun - drunk . [Responsible drunk]159-responsible drunk . [The kind of drunk who talked a little louder , snort - laughed , and danced like [no one]549-no one was watching , but also called [an Uber]550-an uber , saved [[her]550-an uber friends]551-her friends from bad hookups , and never let [anyone in [my]0-i vicinity]552-anyone in my vicinity get a tattoo [they]552-anyone in my vicinity were going to regret the next morning]548-the kind of drunk who talked a little louder , snort - laughed , and danced like no one was watching , but also called an uber , saved her friends from bad hookups , and never let anyone in my vicinity get a tattoo they were going to regret the next morning . Not this time . This time , [I]0-i was crank - up - the - Enola - Gay plastered . [The kind of hammered to end up in [the hospital]554-the hospital with an IV drip , [an oopsie baby]555-an oopsie baby , and a criminal record]553-the kind of hammered to end up in the hospital with an iv drip , an oopsie baby , and a criminal record . There were a variety of reasons [I]0-i was so drunk , and [I]0-i would point all of them out if [I]0-i were able to hold a steady finger in the air . The problem was , now was the worst possible time to be indisposed . [I]0-i was on bridesmaid duty . [The twenty - three - year - old — drumroll]556-the twenty - three - year - old — drumroll , please — [flower girl]557-flower girl ! Was it weird to be [a full - grown flower girl]558-a full - grown flower girl ? Why , not at all . It was an honor . Okay , fine . It was a little embarrassing . And by a little embarrassing , [I]0-i mean soul - crushingly humiliating . Yet saying no was out of the question . [I]0-i was [Persephone]138-persephone . [The easygoing , even - tempered , roll - with - the - punches designated friend]559-the easygoing , even - tempered , roll - with - the - punches designated friend . [The one who kept the peace and dropped everything when someone needed help]560-the one who kept the peace and dropped everything when someone needed help . [Aisling]160-ash , who was about to become [[Sailor]158-sailor ’s sister - in - law]561-sailor ’s sister - in - law , was in charge of holding [the eight - foot train]562-the eight - foot train , à [la Pippa Middleton]161-la pippa middleton , and [[my]0-i sister]541-my sister , [Emmabelle]153-emmabelle , was responsible for the rings . [Thorncrown Chapel]7-thorncrown chapel was [a luxurious wedding venue on [the Massachusetts coastline]565-the massachusetts coastline]564-a luxurious wedding venue on the massachusetts coastline . [The medieval castle]566-the medieval castle looming over [a cliff]567-a cliff boasted fifty acres of old - world architecture , French - imported limestone , [private gardens]568-private gardens , and a view of [the ocean]569-the ocean . [The bridal suite]570-the bridal suite was [an oatmeal - hued apartment]571-an oatmeal - hued apartment that offered a claw - foot tub , [a front porch]572-a front porch , and four fully equipped vanities . All expenses for the lavish wedding were paid by [the groom]573-the groom , [[Hunter Fitzpatrick]162-hunter ’s family]574-hunter fitzpatrick ’s family . [Sailor]158-sailor was marrying up , climbing high up the social ladder . [The Fitzpatricks]163-the fitzpatricks stood shoulder - to - shoulder with [the Rockefellers]164-the rockefellers , [the Kennedys]165-the kennedys , and [the Murdochs]166-the murdochs . Rich , powerful , influential , and — at least , according to the rumors — with enough skeletons in [[their]163-the fitzpatricks closet]575-their closet to open [a cemetery]576-a cemetery . It was crazy to think [the girl [I]0-i ’d played hopscotch with as [a kid]578-a kid and who let [me]0-i cut [her]577-the girl i ’d played hopscotch with as a kid and who let me cut her bangs bangs]577-the girl i ’d played hopscotch with as a kid and who let me cut her bangs was going to become [an American princess]579-an american princess in less than an hour . It was even crazier that [she]577-the girl i ’d played hopscotch with as a kid and who let me cut her bangs was [the one who introduced [me]0-i to [the man who now occupied ninety percent of [my]0-i brain ’s capacity and virtually all [my]0-i dreams]581-the man who now occupied ninety percent of my brain ’s capacity and virtually all my dreams]580-the one who introduced me to the man who now occupied ninety percent of my brain ’s capacity and virtually all my dreams . [The villain who broke [my]0-i heart without even noticing [my]0-i immortal existence]582-the villain who broke my heart without even noticing my immortal existence . Trying to sober up , [I]0-i paced back and forth in [the room]583-the room , stopping at the window . [I]0-i leaned over the sill , tilting [my]0-i face up to the summer sky . A lone cloud glided lazily behind the sun , holding a promise for a gorgeous day . “ [Auntie Tilda]146-auntie tilda , fancy seeing [you]146-auntie tilda here ! How ’ve [you]146-auntie tilda been ? ”[0-i] It was n’t the first time [I]0-i ’d spoken to a cloud like it was [[my]0-i dead aunt]584-my dead aunt , so [I]0-i could n’t blame [my]0-i level of intoxication on this particular quirk . “ Weather ’s looking fine . [Sailor]158-sailor is going to appreciate it . How do [I]0-i look ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i twirled in [my]0-i pine - green gown in front of the window , giving [my]0-i hair a playful toss . “ Think [he]585-he ’ll finally notice [me]0-i ? ”[0-i] The cloud did n’t need to respond for [me]0-i to know the answer — no . [He]585-he was n’t going to notice [me]0-i . [He]585-he never did . [I]0-i highly doubted [he]585-he even knew [I]0-i existed . Five years [I]0-i ’d known [him]585-he , and [he]585-he had yet to speak a word to [me]0-i . Heaving a sigh , [I]0-i grabbed the flowers [I]0-i ’d picked earlier outside [the suite]586-the suite and pressed them to [my]0-i nose with a greedy breath . They smelled warm and fresh , spring - like . The flowers were pink and shaped like a [Valentine]167-valentine ’s heart . [I]0-i wove some of them in [my]0-i hair , which was partly coiffed at the top . One of their thorns pricked [my]0-i finger , and [I]0-i lifted it , sucking on the drop of blood it produced . The stickiness of the sap filled [my]0-i mouth , and [I]0-i groaned . “ [I]0-i know , [I]0-i know , [I]0-i should just get over [him]518-the eldest fitzpatrick brother . Move on . ”[0-i] [I]0-i quickly licked all [my]0-i fingers to get rid of the nectar . “ There ’s a fine line between being [a romantic]3818-a romantic and [a moron]3819-a moron . [The mother]953-the mother and [the baby]1288-the baby stared at [each other]978-each other , and the world around [them]3531-them stopped on its axis . [Astor]435-astor got very quiet and very serious . [Persephone]138-persephone sucked in a breath , and [I]0-i stopped breathing , the pressure of the attack easing down . “ Hello , [little angel]5540-little angel . ”[138-persephone] [She]138-persephone smiled down at [him]435-astor . [He]435-astor stared at [her]138-persephone , mesmerized . [I]0-i know the feeling , [son]5427-son . [I]0-i stood back and watched [them]3531-them . [[My]0-i own little family]3533-my own little family . A perfect thing in [this imperfect world]3534-this imperfect world . Knowing [I]0-i might ’ve passed [Astor]435-astor the very thing that life had cursed [me]0-i with because it was hereditary . And vowing to make sure [Astor]435-astor would never get locked in [a church confession booth]3536-a church confession booth with [his]435-astor demons . That [he]435-astor , too , would one day be able to bask in the light . The End .

This book was definitely a ride to write . It took a lot from [me]0-i mentally and physically . [I]0-i do n’t think [I]0-i would have been able to write it without [[my]0-i support group]3537-my support group . Excerpt from The Kiss Thief Before [you]3547-you go , here ’s a small excerpt of The Kiss Thief . If [you]3547-you enjoyed [Cillian Fitzpatrick]137-cillian , [you]3547-you are going to love [Wolfe Keaton]472-wolfe keaton …

WHAT SUCKED THE MOST WAS that [I]0-i , [Francesca Rossi]473-francesca , had [my]0-i entire future locked inside an unremarkable old wooden box . Since the day [I]0-i ’d been made aware of it — at six years old — [I]0-i knew that whatever waited for [me]0-i inside was going to either kill or save [me]0-i . So it was no wonder that yesterday at dawn , when the sun kissed the sky , [I]0-i decided to rush fate and open it . [I]0-i was n’t supposed to know where [[my]0-i mother]3842-my mother kept the key . [I]0-i was n’t supposed to know where [[my]0-i father]854-my father kept the box . But the thing about sitting at [home]590-home all day and grooming [yourself]3547-you to death so [you]3547-you could meet [[your]3547-you parents]3840-your parents ’ next - to - impossible standards ? [You]3547-you have time — in spades . “ Hold still , [Francesca]473-francesca , or [I]474-veronica ’ll prick [you]473-francesca with the needle , ”[474-veronica] [Veronica]474-veronica whined underneath [me]0-i . [My]0-i eyes ran across the yellow note for the hundredth time as [[my]0-i mother]3842-my mother ’s stylist helped [me]0-i get into [my]0-i dress as if [I]0-i was [an invalid]3561-an invalid . [I]0-i inked the words to memory , locking them in a drawer in [my]0-i brain [no one else]3562-no one else had access to . Excitement blasted through [my]0-i veins like a jazzy tune , [my]0-i eyes zinging with determination in the mirror in front of [me]0-i . [I]0-i folded the piece of paper with shaky fingers and shoved it into the cleavage under [my]0-i unlaced corset . [I]0-i started pacing in [the room]583-the room again , too animated to stand still , making [[Mama]475-mama ’s hairdresser]3564-mama ’s hairdresser and [stylist]3565-stylist bark at [me]0-i as [they]3566-they chased [me]0-i around [the dressing room]3567-the dressing room comically . [I]0-i am [Groucho Marx]476-groucho marx in [Duck Soup]477-duck soup . Catch [me]0-i if [you]3568-you can . [Veronica]474-veronica tugged at the end of [my]0-i corset , pulling [me]0-i back to the mirror as if [I]0-i were on a leash . “ Hey , ouch . ”[0-i] [I]0-i winced . “ Stand still , [I]0-i said ! ”[0-i] It was not uncommon for [[[my]0-i parents]712-my parents ’ employees]3570-my parents ’ employees to treat [me]0-i like a glorified , well - bred poodle . Not that it mattered . [I]0-i was going to kiss [Angelo Bandini]478-angelo tonight . More specifically — [I]0-i was going to let [him]478-angelo kiss [me]0-i . [I]0-i ’d be lying if [I]0-i said [I]0-i had n’t thought about kissing [Angelo]478-angelo every night since [I]0-i returned a year ago from [the Swiss boarding school [[my]0-i parents]712-my parents]124-the swiss boarding school my parents threw [me]0-i in . At nineteen , [Arthur]479-arthur and [Sofia Rossi]480-sofia rossi had officially decided to introduce [me]0-i to [the Chicagoan society]3572-the chicagoan society and let [me]0-i have [my]0-i pick of [a future husband]3573-a future husband from [the hundreds of [eligible Italian - American men who were affiliated with The Outfit]3575-eligible italian - american men who were affiliated with the outfit]3574-the hundreds of eligible italian - american men who were affiliated with the outfit . Tonight was going to kick - start a chain of events and social calls , but [I]0-i already knew whom [I]0-i wanted to marry . [Papa]481-papa and [Mama]475-mama had informed [me]0-i that college was n’t in the cards for [me]0-i . [I]0-i needed to attend to the task of finding [the perfect husband]3576-the perfect husband , seeing as [I]0-i was [an only child]3577-an only child and [the sole heir to [the Rossi businesses]3579-the rossi businesses]3578-the sole heir to the rossi businesses . Being [the first woman in [[my]0-i family]829-my family to ever earn a degree]3580-the first woman in my family to ever earn a degree had been a dream of [mine]0-i , but [I]0-i was nowhere near dumb enough to defy [them]829-my family . [[Our]3582-our maid]3583-our maid , [Clara]482-clara , often said , “ [You]0-i do n’t need to meet [a husband]5087-a husband , [Frankie]397-frankie . [You]0-i need to meet [[your]0-i parents]3840-your parents ’ expectations . ”[482-clara] [She]482-clara was n’t wrong . [I]0-i was born into [a gilded cage]3584-a gilded cage . [It]3584-a gilded cage was spacious , but locked , nonetheless . Trying to escape [it]3584-a gilded cage was risking death . Over the years , [I]0-i ’d watched as [Angelo]478-angelo ’s soft blond curls darkened and were tamed with a trim . [He]478-angelo became more mysterious and less impulsive , spoke less often , but when [he]478-angelo did , [his]478-angelo words liquefied [my]0-i insides . Falling in love was so tragic . No wonder it made [people]3868-people so sad . And while [I]0-i looked at [Angelo]478-angelo as if [he]478-angelo could melt ice cream , [I]0-i was n’t [the only girl who melted from [his]478-angelo constant frown whenever [he]478-angelo looked at [me]0-i]3614-the only girl who melted from his constant frown whenever he looked at me . But [he]478-angelo ’d always made [me]0-i feel like [I]0-i was [The Girl]1381-the girl . [He]478-angelo sneaked flowers into [my]0-i hair , let [me]0-i sip some of [his]478-angelo wine when [no one]549-no one was looking , and laughed with [his]478-angelo eyes whenever [I]0-i spoke . When [[his]478-angelo younger brothers]3619-his younger brothers taunted [me]0-i , [he]478-angelo flicked [their]3619-his younger brothers ears and warned [them]3619-his younger brothers off . And every summer , [he]478-angelo found a way to steal a moment with [me]0-i and kiss the tip of [my]0-i nose . “ [Francesca Rossi]473-francesca , [you]473-francesca ’re even prettier than [you]473-francesca were last summer . ”[478-angelo] “ [You]473-francesca always say that . ”[478-angelo] “ And [I]478-angelo always mean it . “ [I]478-angelo DIDN’T KNOW [VENUS]487-venus HAD wings . ”[478-angelo] [Angelo]478-angelo kissed the back of [my]0-i hand at the doors to [the Art Institute of [Chicago]127-chicago]128-the art institute of chicago masquerade .
